name: Nokia
description:
• Developed a k-path computation Java prototype to compute latency and hops optimized paths with provided service specifications for source destination pairs
• Implemented the service enablement workflow APIs with Spring boot for network slicing orchestration
• Developed a web app POC in React to display computed paths, and network topology on a topoJSON map and create an UI for service enablement

name: March Networks
description:
• Developed REST APIs for the VSAAS platform microservices with node.js, Typescript, gRPC, and TypeORM to add tenant, license, and device management functionality
• Implemented restrictions for super admin roles to manage access to licensed services
• Created and modified HPA policies and load tested Kubernetes clusters to report on performance for the microservices and document bugs and issues
• Refactored event broker service and implemented a pub/sub mechanism with Redis to improve event versioning and WebSocket gateway performance

name: Otrack.io
description:
• Developed modules for native mobile application for IOS and Android in NativeScript and Angular to add updates to currency and payment modules for a grocery app.
• Created Firebase, Gradle, and pod configurations and set up AWS S3 containers and RDS PostgreSQL instance to develop backend infrastructure for clients.
• Redesigned UI for application views using Angular and Sass to improve navigational and display components and enhance user experience.

name: Canadian Institute for Health Information
description:
• Developed a comparison report service in Java to highlight discrepancies and changes made upon data loading that improved the quality assurance for the database.
• Migrated a legacy application from Struts to Spring and refactored backend services and controllers ensuring improved support and maintenance for future updates.
• Designed solutions to resolve problems relating to validation, messaging, and authentication to improve code design and performance.

name: Carleton Computer Science
description: • TA for fundamentals of web applications in fall 2020 and intro to systems engineering in winter 2021

name: ITREB Canada - Virtual Learning Center
description:
• Developed and administered an LTI K-12 learning platform for ITREB Canada using Moodle to host integrated programming for 5000 students across the country
• Developed customized report services using MySQL and Python to compile user statistics, track progress and generate activity reports
